document_metadata.title: Entailment Method Based on Template Selection for Chinese Text Few-shot Learning
institutions: School of Artificial Intelligence, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China

base_methods.evidence_text: We choose MacBERT, a pre-training model, as our backbone
We address this by introducing a template selection mechanism using a masked language model to assess candidate templates

compared_methods.comparison_result: EFL is more effective on sentence-pair tasks, while PET is better for single sentence classification
compared_methods.evidence_text: The results on the testing datasets of the nine NLP tasks show that the EFL method with automatic template selection outperforms other methods

datasets_used.dataset_description: encompassing sentiment analysis, short text classification, long text classification, natural language inference, sentence similarity, Chinese cloze, and co-reference resolution
datasets_used.evidence_text: We evaluate nine Chinese few-shot datasets of Few-CLUE
Intermediate training with an entailment dataset like CMNLI

quantitative_results.evidence_text: The results on the testing datasets of the nine NLP tasks show that the EFL method with automatic template selection outperforms other methods

stated_contributions: introducing a template selection mechanism using a masked language model to assess candidate templates
